items.title: IDF amends cause of death of four soldiers killed in September Rafah operation
items.summary: According to the IDF, the officers were traveling as the lead vehicle in a convoy during offensive operations in Rafah when the explosion occurred.

items.title: France to bring in form of military service, 25 years after conscription was phased out
items.summary: "The only way to avoid danger is to prepare for it," says President Emmanuel Macron.

items.title: Gazans' stark choice: Either Hamas, or reconstruction
items.summary: Polls show they think they can have both, but the reality is that no one will invest in a place readying for another round of destructive warfare

items.title: Far-right Israeli lawmaker denied U.S. visa amid recent police investigations
items.summary: A Channel 12 report said the Knesset member, a prominent West Bank settler activist, was asked during his interview at the U.S. Embassy when he was last questioned by police, and replied, 'Yesterday'

items.title: Judge chosen by gov't to oversee Sde Teiman leak probe suspected of harassment in U.S.; case closed
items.summary: U.S. legal documents obtained by Haaretz reveal that the investigation against Yosef Ben Hamo was opened in Pennsylvania in May of this year, but the case was closed in July. According to a report by Channel 13 News, the criminal proceedings began after a 'close associate' of the retired judge filed

items.title: Venezuela bans six major airlines after tensions with US escalate
items.summary: The affected carriers ceased flying to Venezuela after the US warned of heightened military activity.

items.title: Australia lists Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard as state sponsor of terrorism
items.summary: Australia in August accused Iran of directing two antisemitic arson attacks in the cities of Sydney and Melbourne, and expelled Tehran's ambassador for the first time since World War Two

items.title: As flames run high, U.S. adopts Israel's aggressive approach for peace in Lebanon
items.summary: Washington, with the help of Israeli attacks, hopes to compel the Lebanese government and Army to disarm Hezbollah. Moreover, the U.S. postulates that Israeli aggression can force Lebanon to enter diplomatic negotiations with Israel, possibly even joining the Abraham Accords

items.title: Year after ceasefire, peace eludes south Lebanon as Israeli strikes continue
items.summary: A year on from a ceasefire in Lebanon, Israel is continuing attacks on what it says are Hezbollah's efforts to recover from their war.

items.title: Arab officials say Trump must push Israel on Gaza withdrawal to secure Hamas' disarmament
items.summary: Sources in the Cairo talks told Haaretz that neither Hamas nor Israel seems willing to advance the cease-fire. Palestinian and Arab sources say Hamas will not disarm without a clear Israeli withdrawal and a plan for handling surrendered weapons

items.title: Watch: Dawn aerial footage reveals scale of Hong Kong apartment blaze
items.summary: More than 800 firefighters were still tackling the blaze at Wang Fuk Court this morning.

items.title: Israeli settlers graffiti, set fire to mosque in central West Bank
Fracking has transformed an Argentine town - but what about the nation?
items.summary: Argentina hopes that an oil and gas boom can benefit the whole country.

items.title: The Theatre of the Grotesque: Israeli officials use the law to bully residents of East Jerusalem
Watch: How the shooting of two National Guard members unfolded
items.summary: The two soldiers are in critical condition after being attacked blocks from the White House in Washington DC.

items.title: Two National Guard soldiers in critical condition after 'targeted' attack near White House
items.summary: A suspect now in custody was also shot but is not expected to suffer life-threatening injuries. Authorities said the investigation is ongoing

items.title: Citing 'critical discussions,' Netanyahu tells graft trial he cannot testify three days a week
items.summary: Testifying in his corruption trial for the 57th time, the Israeli prime minister answered questions about his claims that the Walla news website was negligible and unimportant, the amount of money spent on advertising that site during the 2015 election and the role of his son managing media coverage

items.title: Despite differences, Israel's opposition must work together to replace Netanyahu
items.summary: As the government works to erode state institutions, the opposition must recognize the pattern, link these assaults across arenas and confront a campaign designed to evade accountability for October 7

items.title: This Israeli government simply hates women
Haaretz Cartoon
Israeli Minister Chikli seeks U.S. terror designation for CAIR, citing Trump on Muslim Brotherhood
items.summary: Israel's Diaspora Affairs minister claims 'conclusive evidence' links the U.S.-based Council on American-Islamic Relations to Hamas and the Muslim Brotherhood; CAIR called this a 'conspiracy theory,' noting it has long condemned all terrorism, including Hamas suicide bombings and October 7 attacks o

items.title: 'Failure of judgment': Following backlash, writer Peter Beinart apologizes for speaking at Tel Aviv University
items.summary: Beinart, an outspoken Jewish voice for Palestinian rights, had previously defended his decision to speak at the event, emphasizing the importance of engaging with Israelis

items.title: What Elton John gets right that Israel's Foreign Ministry gets wrong
items.summary: When the pop star voiced concern about the suffering of some overshadowed by Gaza, he meant it. The same can't be said for the pro-Israel warriors who point to Sudan because they can no longer defend the indefensible

items.title: What do you know about the IDF, Israel's sacred cow?
The visionary Palestinian peace plan for Israel and Gaza that you've never heard of
items.summary: A 51-page document by a group of Palestinian scholars and policy thinkers offers a much clearer path to Middle East peace than the UN resolution or Trump's 20-point plan

items.title: Is antisemitism as American as baseball and apple pie?
items.summary: In 'Antisemitism, an American Tradition,' historian Pamela Nadell challenges the concept of a safe haven as she traces the persistence of anti-Jewish sentiment, from colonial times to contemporary attacks

items.title: Gaza journalist posts video of himself in the Strip after Israel falsely claimed he is in Poland
items.summary: An Israeli Foreign Ministry post on X accused Motasem A Dalloul, a Gaza-based journalist who lost his wife and children in Israeli bombings, of being in Poland, after a new feature on the platform misattributed his location

items.title: These two Israeli ministers are vacationing on the taxpayers' dime
New York congressman confronts The New School over 'Hillel funds genocide' campaign
items.summary: The congressman said of the campaign that 'this kind of antisemitism has no place in our city.' An anonymous student letter claimed Hillel 'is complicit in genocide' and 'espouses Jewish supremacist ideology'

items.title: IDF chief says Israel needs leaders who don't 'evade responsibility' amid feud with defense minister
items.summary: IDF chief Eyal Zamir made the remarks at a Ben-Gurion memorial, following a public clash with Defense Minister Katz over senior IDF appointments and the army's handling of the October 7 attacks

items.title: Israeli suicide drone company Uvision acquires attack drone start-up
items.summary: The companies said the acquisition is another stage in the expansion of the Uvision Group and strengthens its ability to work from unit level to strategic levels. The startup, SpearUAV, develops small autonomous drones called VIPER launched from a capsule in the field

items.title: As Jews, we reject Israel's proposed death penalty law for Hamas terrorists
items.summary: Despite claims by far-right National Security Minister Itamar Ben-Gvir, instituting the death penalty will almost certainly not deter terrorists. Instead, it encourage more attacks, while propelling Israel across a moral red line

items.title: Does this new film about Israeli hostages killed by the IDF amount to Foreign Ministry propaganda?
items.summary: The full-length feature 'Stay Forte,' about the abduction and killing of Alon Shamriz, Yotam Haim and Samer Talalka, focuses on the heinous nature of Hamas and overlooks the drama and heroism of the three men

items.title: U.S. bill proposes 'Jewish Refugee Day' commemorating expulsion of Jews from Arab nations
items.summary: If approved, Nov. 30 would commemorate the departure and expulsion of roughly 900,000 Jews from Arab countries following the founding of the state of Israel. The holiday was first adopted by Israel in 2014

items.title: A project by Iranian exiles in LA might predict the future of Israeli music abroad
items.summary: If Israel degenerates into a religious autocracy, maybe a collection similar to 'Tehrangeles Vice' will come out in Europe one day, bring together Hebrew music  in the Diaspora – and give Israelis at home the strength to resist

items.title: Smotrich doubles tax-exemption ceiling for personal imports to Israel to $150
items.summary: The order will take effect in no fewer than 21 days. The Israel Tax Authority estimates that the loss of tax revenue could reach up to one billion shekels per year ($304 million). It remains unclear what budgetary source will be used to offset this revenue loss

items.title: 'I don't want to live in a ghetto to feel safe': Young Jews in Berlin question a future in Germany
items.summary: Incidents of antisemitism on campuses have skyrocketed since October 7 and the Gaza war. For a German generation of Jews raised on their parents' stories of persecution under the Soviets, it is starting to feel like déjà vu

items.title: Jewish groups at Penn sound alarm over federal lawsuit seeking information on Jewish employees
items.summary: Penn is not the first school hit by a probe for Jewish contacts. In April, professors at Barnard College received texts from the federal government asking if they were Jewish as part of the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission's review

items.title: 'Certainly not for Jews': Why did Israel kill off the death penalty?
items.summary: After years of debate, Israel decided to end capital punishment in 1954. 'If I lived in Scandinavia, I'd vote without hesitation to abolish the death penalty,' said Ben-Gurion in one discussion on the matter. 'Here, I'll vote with a heavy heart'

items.title: Lebanon, Cyprus sign maritime demarcation deal, paving way for possible energy exploration
items.summary: Lebanon and Israel delineated their maritime borders in 2022 under a U.S.-brokered deal, and Syria is the final country with which Lebanon has yet to delineate its sea border. Lebanon hopes offshore gas and oil discoveries could help reverse a 2019 financial collapse

items.title: With hostage Dror Or's body returned, his Gaza border kibbutz mourns a man of 'big, unconventional dreams'
items.summary: Dror Or, from Kibbutz Be'eri, set out to transform his kibbutz's dairy industry, traveling to Europe to refine his craft. 'He was one of those Israelis we love to love, the kind the country is so desperately missing,' says Dafi Cramer, a culinary tour guide in the Gaza-border region

items.title: A weaker counterweight to Netanyahu's judicial coup: What happened to Israel's High Court?
items.summary: Three recent rulings show how the court's more conservative jurisprudence since Netanyahu retook office and amid the Gaza war has given the government greater leeway, even for legally questionable actions. 'Israel's factionalism and polarization also seep into the Supreme Court,' said one legal expe

items.title: IDF probe finds army failed to protect Moshav Yated on Oct. 7 as Hamas terrorists outnumbered security squad
items.summary: After the Gaza border community's security chief arrested a terrorist near the fence, the IDF brigade commander managed to establish contact with the Air Force control tower and requested support, but a combat helicopter did not arrive until 40 minutes later

items.title: Israeli human rights groups tell UN that Israel increased use of torture during Gaza war
items.summary: The report submitted to the UN notes that detainees received medical treatment while shackled and blindfolded, and were forced to use diapers to relieve themselves. It also says detainees were starved, with 'an official diet of approximately 1,000 calories daily'

items.title: IDF launches major West Bank counterterrorism operation, reportedly arresting 22 Palestinians
items.summary: According to Palestinian reports, the IDF entered the northern West Bank city of Tubas with armored vehicles, took over Palestinian homes and converted them into military outposts. The Al-Quds Brigades said 'they're ready' to respond to the Israeli incursion

items.title: 'At most Leo may be bothered by Israeli drones overhead': Pope makes first foreign trip to Lebanon, Turkey
items.summary: Pope Leo will not visit Lebanon's south, battered by last year's war between Israel and Hezbollah and the site of intensified Israeli strikes in recent weeks. Israel's recent strike that killed Hezbollah's chief of staff in Beirut reinforced security concerns

items.title: Body of Israeli hostage Dror Or returned from Gaza after 781 days in captivity
items.summary: Dror Or, 48, was murdered during the October 7 Hamas attack and kidnapped from his home on Kibbutz Be'eri. His wife Yonat was also murdered, and two of their children were kidnapped to Gaza and released in an earlier hostage deal

items.title: Netanyahu's lingering grip on power hinges on delegitimizing Israel's Arab voters and their leaders
items.summary: The chances that the prime minister will manage to outlaw the United Arab List are slim, but his government will wage a smear campaign against a bloc that could be a major obstacle to victory in the election. As a bonus, this would also hamstring the opposition

items.title: U.S. senators urge Trump to investigate IDF violations of U.S. human rights law
Haaretz Cartoon
Despite ruling by Israel's top court, Palestinian security prisoners say they are still underfed
items.summary: Rights groups petitioned the High Court of Justice, arguing that the Israel Prison Service was not fulfilling a ruling issued three months ago, ordering the state to provide basic sustenance. 'Some of my clients have lost half of their body weight since they were incarcerated,' one lawyer said

items.title: I wear a niqab for the love of God. That's not good enough for this Israeli University
items.summary: This is not just my personal story; it is a discussion of principle concerning freedom of religion and conscience, equality and the right to education

items.title: Israel's October 7 government will stop at nothing to blame the army
Israel's leaders abandon 'total victory' for endless war and public control
Every physician in Israel must object to the death penalty
A coalition that includes Arab parties is the litmus test of Israel's liberal democracy
Netanyahu remains 'determined' to mend rift between IDF chief and defense minister
items.summary: The Israeli prime minister has refrained from publicly backing either Israel Katz or Eyal Zamir in their latest clash, which erupted after the IDF chief dismissed senior officers for their responsibility for the events of October 7 without first notifying the defense minister

items.title: Prominent New York Rabbi calls for 'civic awakening' in Jewish community after synagogue protest
items.summary: Rabbi Elliot Cosgrove labeled Mamdani's response to the anti-Israel protest as 'victim blaming' and warned of the growing influence of the Democratic Socialists of America, calling Mamdani's win 'the tip of the spear'

items.title: Peter Beinart wants to burst Israelis' echo chamber and BDS doesn't like it
items.summary: Faced with deepening isolation, Israelis risk becoming more militant, more insular and more reactive to any force they perceive as a threat. The goal, then, seems to be to turn Israel into the worst version of itself

items.title: Israeli concerts honoring iconic Egyptian singer Umm Kulthum rankle Arab world
items.summary: Allegations of cultural appropriation and 'artistic theft' abound as Israel's Firqat Alnoor Orchestra, which has both Jewish and Arab members, tours the country. The singer's family members now plan to sue

items.title: 'I'm not sure democracy will survive': Israeli 2025 Nobel laureate fears for the West's future
items.summary: After decades studying economic history, the Israeli recipient of the Nobel Prize in Economic Sciences, Prof. Joel Mokyr, has a bleak forecast for the West, but believes technological innovation will continue. 'Our world is still competitive, and that's what will save us'

items.title: Likud lawmaker admits justice ministry oversight bill to be used against AG, prosecution
items.summary: Despite Moshe Saada's revelation, the matter was not included in the bill's draft notes before a committee meeting on the bill. Opposition members criticized the move as a political tool to intimidate legal institutions and oust the attorney general

items.title: Stretched thin: IDF plans little training in 2026 amid manpower shortage
items.summary: The manpower shortage and expanded border deployments leave regular brigades with only a handful of training weeks. The new Haredi brigade will not man the borders next year. IDF Spokesperson: 'The operational deployment chart is still under assessment and has not yet been finalized'

items.title: Death penalty bill will severely harm Israel's security, former security and legal officials say
items.summary: Former Shin Bet directors and legal advisers warned that a bill meant to curb terrorism would cause backlash and harm national security. 'The death penalty is unacceptable in terms of legal norms, therefore, unconstitutional,' an open letter read, noting it would change Israel's international status

items.title: Mamdani names five New York rabbis to transition team after synagogue-protest backlash
items.summary: The appointments come days after Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani drew considerable fire from the Jewish community for saying a synagogue promoting immigration to Israel should not encourage 'activities in violation of international law' on its premises

items.title: Building on Ruins: The Russification of Mariupol, One Apartment Block at a Time
items.summary: × “They Are Building Houses on Bones” It’s the second time Moreva has lost her home. She fled to Mariupol from Makiivka, an industrial city near Donetsk, after Russia occupied Donbas in 2014. The 57-year-old rebuilt her life in the port city, working as a professor in Mariupol State University’s eco

items.title: Geolocating Darfur Killings of Those Escaping Al Fashir
items.summary: Warning: Contains written descriptions of extreme violence including murder. All graphic footage has been omitted. A Bellingcat investigation has identified and verified the exact location of a mass killing of more than 80 people that took place near Al Fashir during the recent siege and takeover of

items.summary: An investigation by Bellingcat has identified yet another Russian-flagged bulk carrier, Irtysh (IMO: 9664976), operating in defiance of Western sanctions by exporting grain from occupied Crimea to Houthi-controlled Yemen.  Following the same pattern of deceptive methods used by other vessels in

Editor’s note: Vladislav Gillung officially changed his name to Vladislav Romanov in his twenties. Although the first recorded use of him as Romanov is from the period between 2020 and 2022, we will r

items.title: Wildfires Ravage One of Africa’s Largest Nature Reserves
items.summary: Late last month, fires engulfed Namibia’s most visited wildlife reserve – Etosha National Park. An analysis of satellite imagery by Bellingcat has found that more than a third of the park was affected, impacting crucial grazing lands for endangered species, including black rhinos, giraffes and

items.title: Australian Cocaine Pilot Killed in Brazil Plane Crash Linked to Kinahan Drug Cartel
items.summary: This article is the result of a collaboration with The Sunday Times. To stay up to date on our latest investigations, join Bellingcat’s new WhatsApp channel here. An Australian pilot who recently died when his small plane crashed in South America during a failed drug run has links to an alleged Kina

items.title: Like Clockwork: An Orange Wall Exposes Yet Another Active Club ‘Fight Night’
items.summary: To stay up to date on our latest investigations, join Bellingcat’s new WhatsApp channel here. The organisers of an annual combat sports event allegedly told the venue owner that they were using the space to film an activewear commercial featuring a small “crowd” including women and children.&#

items.title: Incendiary Munitions Strike Gaza-bound Flotilla Two Nights in a Row
items.summary: On September 8 and 9, two vessels of the Gaza-bound Global Sumud Flotilla (GSF) were attacked outside the port of Sidi Bou Said in Tunisia. Bellingcat analysed footage and images from both incidents. The experts consulted believe improvised incendiary munitions were likely used. The trajectory follo

items.title: Trump’s Takeover of DC: Traffic Stops Turn Into Immigration Arrests for Delivery Riders and Workers
items.summary: Four masked men in police tactical vests surround a young scooter rider, cuffing his hands behind his back. One person, whose face is fully obscured with a cap, sunglasses and a balaclava, is heard on eyewitness video telling the scooter rider: “You came into this country as a J1, as an exchange stu
